item.title: By: Dom
item.dc:creator: Dom
item.description: Interesting topic. In the german speaking world and Business Intelligence area, someone has done quite a bit of work on charts and the best way to convey a message: http://www.hichert.com/en/success.html Maybe not all are relevant, but there are quite a few tips and interesting good practices. In his methodology, pie charts are not exactly the best way to express a view, but waterfalls definitely are.
item.content:encoded:
Interesting topic. In the german speaking world and Business Intelligence area, someone has done quite a bit of work on charts and the best way to convey a message: http://www.hichert.com/en/success.html
Maybe not all are relevant, but there are quite a few tips and interesting good practices. In his methodology, pie charts are not exactly the best way to express a view, but waterfalls definitely are.

item.title: By: Toshiyuki Hayashi
item.dc:creator: Toshiyuki Hayashi
item.description: Hi, the articles about dashboard design are quite informative for me. May I make a translation of it? I'd like to share this with Japanese people who are interested in this kind of things. Thanks!
item.content:encoded: Hi, the articles about dashboard design are quite informative for me. May I make a translation of it? I’d like to share this with Japanese people who are interested in this kind of things. Thanks!

item.title: By: Krist Wongsuphasawat (@kristw)
item.dc:creator: Krist Wongsuphasawat (@kristw)
item.content:encoded:
Great collection of dashboard inspirations on Pinterest.

Also really agree with “Dashboards are not collection of individual charts, but an ensemble. Components of a dashboard should not be thought individually but as pieces that fit with one another.”

Thanks for sharing!
